item.title: Parametric Regression Model in Survival Analysis
item.description: body { text-align: justify} There are differences between Parametric Models (e.g. Kaplan-Meier), Semi-Parametric Models (e.g. Cox Proportional Hazard), and Non-Parametric Models. The graph below gives the main pieces of information. A survival analysis can be defined as consisting of two parts: the core survial object with a time indicator plus the corresponding event status (used to calculate the baseline hazard). The second part of the survival model consists of the covariates.
